DataElement.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Performed Study Activity Status Date and Time ISO21090.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A characteristic or requirement that disqualifies a subject from participation in a study. EXAMPLE(S): pregnancy The date (and time) on which the status is assigned to the activity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Performed Study Activity Status Date and Time
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._A condition or state at a particular time.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.
An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains TS so that it's precision can not be more precise than seconds.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/09/2010 - Missing from original list of ISO21090 VDs.
